action.action-desc: Ms. Porter introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to ensure prompt refunds for cancelled flights, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Prompt Refunds for Cancelled Flights Act.

subsection.header: Unfair and deceptive practices and unfair methods of competition
subsection.text: Section 41712 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: It shall be an unfair or deceptive practice under subsection (a) for any air carrier, foreign air carrier, or ticket agent that sells a ticket for air transportation to fail to provide a covered refund with respect to such ticket if the air transportation is cancelled or significantly changed.
Paragraph (1) does not apply if a ticket holder voluntarily accepts alternative transportation or other compensation offered in lieu of a covered refund.

subparagraph.text: The term covered refund means a refund of the amount paid for a ticket for air transportation that is provided—

clause.text: to the holder of the ticket;
in the same format in which the amount was paid; and

subclause.text: in the case of payment by credit card, debit card, or other electronic format, 48 hours after the relevant cancellation or significant change; or
in the case of payment by cash or check, 14 days after the relevant cancellation or significant change.

subparagraph.text: The term significantly changed means, with respect to air transportation, that—

clause.text: the departure or arrival time associated with such transportation has changed—

subclause.text: in the case of air transportation within the United States, by 3 or more hours; or
in the case of air transportation to or from a location outside the United States, by 6 or more hours;

clause.text: the departure or arrival airport associated with such transportation has changed;
the number of intermediate stops associated with such transportation has increased; or
the type of aircraft associated with such transportation has changed and, as determined by the Secretary, the change will result in a significant downgrade of the air transportation experience.

subsection.text: Section 46301(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Penalty for failure To provide covered refund
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding paragraphs (1) and (5)(D), the amount of a civil penalty for a violation of section 41712(d) shall be the amount that is 10 times the amount paid for the relevant cancelled or significantly changed air transportation.
